name: Back Neck Stretch
how_to_perform:
1. Begin by sitting or standing in a comfortable position with your back straight and shoulders relaxed.
2. Place your feet flat on the ground if you are seated.
3. Slowly drop your chin towards your chest, feeling a gentle stretch at the back of your neck.
4. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your spine straight as you hold this position.
5. You can increase the stretch by gently bringing your hands to the back of your head and applying light pressure to deepen the stretch. Ensure not to force the movement.
6. Maintain the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds, breathing deeply and evenly throughout.
7. Slowly return to the starting position by raising your head back to neutral.
8. Repeat the stretch 2-3 times for optimal results.
short_summary: The Back Neck Stretch is a simple exercise to relieve tension in the back of the neck and upper spinal area.
